meanings.definition: The quality or state of being revolutionary.
meanings.sent1: Her passion for change and innovation truly embodies the revolutionarinesses of her character.
meanings.sent2: The revolutionarinesses of the new technology sparked excitement among the community.
meanings.sent3: The revolutionarinesses of the idea to have a pet parade at work brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, her designs stood out for their revolutionarinesses, like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the revolutionarinesses of the era, making history come alive on canvas.

meanings.definition: The revolutionary nature or character of something.
meanings.sent1: The revolutionarinesses of the political movement inspired hope for a better future.
meanings.sent2: When discussing art history, the revolutionarinesses of Picasso's work cannot be overlooked.
meanings.sent3: The revolutionarinesses of the new ice cream flavor made it an instant hit with customers.
meanings.sent4: The revolutionarinesses of the discovery changed the course of scientific research forever.
meanings.sent5: His speech highlighted the revolutionarinesses of the human spirit, urging people to strive for greatness.
